lead_paragraph: There has been talk of establishing, after the war, a permanent and potent international political agency, be it called a federation, league or United States of the World. But the central problem that will confront the postwar world does not embrace simply the establishment of some form of international government and its police counterpart.
abstract: lr on post-war internatl police force problem
